metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11472 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The acpi_ns_terminate() function in drivers/acpi/acpica/nsutils.c in theLinux kernel before 4.12 does not flush the operand cache and causes akernel stack dump, which allows local users to obtain sensitive informationfrom kernel memory and bypass the KASLR protection mechanism (in the kernelthrough 4.9) via a crafted ACPI table.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11472` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-119.143
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-119.143
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-119.143
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1086-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1086.94
No subscription required
